this will work with any of our

whatever is currently your favorite

want you to form it into a loaf that's

inches high now you can do this on a

and as you may know you can't use the

and fibrous so just go ahead and pull

and it's nice of their whole because
we're going to slice these up but if a
few break don't worry shitake happens
alright so slice those up and at that

when I see that foamy part of the butter
start to turn a little bit tan I will
throw in those mushrooms with a big

stage one they're just going to kind of
get I don't know slimy and they'll just
kind of sizzle like that and then if you

at that stage I'm going to add a pinch
of fresh rosemary alright so give that a

which is going to make yes a roux so
we're going to stir in the flour it's
going to get all clumpy and kind of dry
and
no kind of ugly looking that's okay we
just want to coat the mushrooms with the
flour we're going to just cook that for
about three minutes just like that it's
not going to look good it's not supposed
to don't worry we're just taking the raw
edge off the flour at that point you're
going to pour in your cold beef broth
all right maybe half a cup at a time
just pour it in whisk pour it in whisk
and because the stock the broth is cold
and the roux is hot there's no lumps so
stir that in alright we're going to turn
the heat up to high bring this up to a
simmer and of course because it's a roux
as soon as it comes to a simmer it will
thicken up we're going to season that
with salt and freshly ground black
pepper so that's going to come up to a

that point we're going to turn off the
heat and stir in our heavy cream okay
and that's basically it so now we're
exactly at the stage you saw at the

so one tip make sure you make this sauce
in something that can go into the oven
because that's how we're going to cook

Brown the top and then baste it with
